tweets.text: Forget Farming Rules for Water, lack of enforcement, frozen ground slurry spreading, WFD status or ecological damage to rivers. Surely soils & slurry leaving the land at a rate of knots is not a good farm business model?! @NFUtweets @EnvAgencyNW @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/1c0srjevWI

tweets.text: Pumps are operating in Malton, Old Malton and Norton to deal with high ground water. The footpath on Church Street, Norton, is closed as a pump is deployed there. We're working closely with @northyorkscc @EnvAgency @YorkshireWater to respond quickly to the situation.#floodaware

Due to heavy rain we have started to deploy Phase 1 of the #Northwich Scheme & will be erecting temporary defences at Barons Quay. This is being done as a precaution to protect the community from potential high river levels

Check your #flood risk 👉https://t.co/DelUfH7Qeq https://t.co/uS1SaUlRhF

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text:
A flood warning has been issued by the Environment Agency for the River Weaver at Acton Bridge and Weaverham.

River levels are rising as a result of the persistent rainfall. @EnvAgencyNW is monitoring the situation and will issue updates as necessary https://t.co/NijiuY4cB4

@RachSalv @GeorgeMonbiot @DrKateSpencer @EnvAgency Nor, I should add, is the landowner - nor, of course, the private firm that previously dumped the waste here: it was bought up and amalgamated in a corporate merger years ago. So who cleans it up? The austerity-bitten public purse?

2nd significant flood in 3 weeks, 3rd significant flood in 5 years with communities and properties damaged.  What’s the answer?  What’s the plan? @EnvAgency @CambsCC #flooding #alconburyweston https://t.co/SHOTSltSOQ

Amazing, there are Curlews in the Liverpool City Region. I feel that sometimes people forget the amount of amazing wildlife here we have here in the North West. With internationally important sites in Sefton & Curlews here in the Hale - there’s som much to be proud of! 🤙🏻 https://t.co/qtK2jCNkDr

The @EnvAgency investigated the "HS2 pollution incident" at Shardeloes Lake back in May 2020 and saw nothing. No example of being the most "environmentally responsible major infrastructure project in UK history". More let's hide the problems until full environmental approval. https://t.co/eDRZWPzzPL

urls.title: Flooding – Herefordshire Council
urls.description: Information about preparing for a flood, what to do during a flood, flood reporting, after a flood and grants

tweets.text:
@PeterReavill There’s a huge amount already happening with natural flood management. @HfdsCouncil programme is an excellent example here https://t.co/PWiqavs7B9

Suspect we’ll be seeing more of beavers too.

@kernowbeaver @sophiepavs @BeaverTrust @TonyJuniper @pow_rebecca @ZacGoldsmith @EnvAgency Thank you, 
It’s actually starting to make sense how over time these differences have impacted our green lands 
Nature to me is like an expensive Lego set,
Yeah you can build it with a few pieces missing 
But it needs all the pieces to truely function and be complete,
